title: How to Use Post-It Notes on Mac Desktop: Easy User Guide

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . It's the two-toned smiley face icon on the Dock.

steps.title: Click the Applications folder.
steps.content: Click the Applications folder. It's in the left panel.

steps.title: Double-click Stickies.
steps.content: Double-click Stickies . It's in the right panel. This opens the Stickies app.

steps.title: Drag Stickies to your Dock (optional).
steps.content: Drag Stickies to your Dock (optional). If you think you'll be using the Stickies app a lot, it'll be helpful to add its icon to your Dock. When the icon is on your Dock, you can quickly open Stickies by clicking it rather than accessing it through Finder. This should create a new note automatically. If you donâ€™t see a new note, or you just want to create another note, read on.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It's at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click New note on the menu.
steps.content: Click New note on the menu. This creates a blank sticky note. You can also create a new sticky note by pressing Cmd + N on the keyboard. You can have multiple stickies open at once. To move a sticky, click and drag it from the horizontal bar at the top of the note.

steps.title: Change the color of the note.
steps.content: Change the color of the note. You can make your sticky note yellow, blue, green, gray, pink, or purple. Here's how: Click an existing note or create a new one . Click the Color menu at the top of the screen. Select a color for your note. If you want to make the note more see-through, click the Window menu at the top of the screen and select Translucent .

steps.title: Use a different font in your sticky note.
steps.content: Use a different font in your sticky note. You can change the font used on your sticky note to any of the regular Mac fonts. You can also make text bold, italic, change its size, and more. Here's how: To change text you've already typed into a sticky note, highlight it first. Click the Font menu at the top of the screen. To select a different font, click Show Fonts and make your selection. Click Bigger to make text bigger, and Smaller to make text smaller. Use the Kerning menu to determine how close together the letters are. Use the Ligatures menu to determine whether to display special combined characters in fonts that support this feature. The Baseline menu contains options for using Subscript or Superscript . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make a sticky note float on top of other windows.
steps.content: Make a sticky note float on top of other windows. If you want a certain sticky note to stay visible on the screen when you're using other apps (including those that are full-screen), you can make the sticky "float": Click an existing note or create a new one. Click the Window menu at the top of the screen. Click Floating Window .

steps.title: Collapse a note.
steps.content: Collapse a note. You can use the Collapse feature to "roll up" your sticky note when you don't need it to be visible: Click the sticky note you want to collapse. Double-click the horizontal bar that runs along the top of the window to collapse it. [2] X Research source Only the bar will be visible. Double-click the bar again to expand the sticky note. You can also press Cmd + M to quickly collapse and reactivate notes.

steps.title: Create a list in your sticky note.
steps.content: Create a list in your sticky note. You can create a bulleted list in a sticky note: Click the place in your note where you'd like the list to begin. Press the Option + Tab keys at the same time. Type the first item in your list and press Return . Continue typing list items. To add another level to your list, click the beginning of a line and press the Tab key. To go up a level, press Shift + Tab . When you're finished with your list, press Return twice to end it.

steps.title: Delete a sticky note.
steps.content: Delete a sticky note. If you don't need a note anymore, you can delete it: Click the note you want to delete. Click the box at the top-left corner of the note. Click Delete note .
